intro: Amphicosmia tahitensis, commonly known as the Tahitian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branched. Amphicosmia tahitensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and plays a role in the local flora of the region.
